title: Centralized heart rate monitoring telemetry system using ZigBee wireless sensor network
abstract: Recent advances in wireless communication standards and medical monitoring system have made it possible to effectively combine mesh networking with Non-Invasive medical application which is Pulse Oximeter in order to create reliable, large-scale wireless Network. This Mesh networking will enable doctors and nurses to observe and monitor a number of patients simultaneously from one location without being with the patient's physically. This project is mainly concerned about monitoring patient's condition simultaneously via Wireless Mesh Network. Wireless Mesh Network is a network that allows data transmitted to the node's nearest neighbors and it can be easily maintained as each node are self configuring and self healing. Data obtained from multiple pulse oximeters will be stored and processed using Arduino-Nano, then transmitted to a centralized unit, where the information for multiple oximeter will be displayed simultaneously. The efficiency of data transmission was monitored and verified. Mesh networking for pulse oximeter had been successfully design to show the active pulse oximeter. Besides, the data transmit and received by the XBee were accurate and it had been proved through several observations.

motivations: Current medical monitoring systems require physical presence of doctors and nurses to observe patients' conditions.
There is a need for a reliable and large-scale wireless network to enable simultaneous monitoring of multiple patients.
objectives: Design a centralized heart rate monitoring telemetry system using ZigBee wireless sensor network.
Enable doctors and nurses to monitor multiple patients simultaneously from one location using a wireless mesh network.
methods: Implement a wireless mesh network using ZigBee protocol to transmit data from pulse oximeters to a centralized unit.
Use Arduino-Nano to store and process data from multiple pulse oximeters.
Utilize XBee modules for data transmission and reception.
results: Successfully designed a mesh networking system for pulse oximeter to display active pulse oximeter data.
Verified the accuracy of data transmission and reception using XBee modules.
Enabled simultaneous monitoring of multiple patients' conditions using a centralized unit.

motivations: Healthcare providers need efficient systems to monitor multiple patients simultaneously without requiring physical presence at each patient's location.
Traditional patient monitoring systems lack the flexibility and scalability offered by modern wireless communication technologies.
objectives: Develop a centralized heart rate monitoring system using ZigBee wireless sensor network technology to enable simultaneous monitoring of multiple patients.
Implement a reliable mesh networking solution that allows self-configuring and self-healing capabilities for medical monitoring applications.
